title: Google Business Profile Management Assistant (Freelance, Fully Trained)
description:
We’re looking for a reliable, detail?oriented freelancer to help us manage local businesses inside our Google Business Profile management software.



You do not need prior experience with no?code tools or similar platforms. We provide straightforward training and clear step?by?step SOPs. Your main job is to follow the process accurately inside the software.



What you’ll do

Log into our platform and manage multiple local business accounts.



Update business details (name, address, phone, hours, service areas) according to provided information.



Add and edit posts, photos, services, and basic descriptions using our templates.



Help manage reviews: apply our templates to draft responses and update review status in the system.



Apply our settings/checklists per client, making sure each profile is correctly configured.



Keep simple records of what was done for each business (status notes, dates, actions taken).



What’s not required

No coding or technical development.



No sales, upselling, or client closing.



No advanced marketing strategy — you will follow clear instructions and templates.



We provide

Full training on the software and our workflow.



Written SOPs and short video walkthroughs for each task type.



Ongoing support and feedback so you can get faster and more confident over time.



Requirements

Strong attention to detail — you double?check names, phone numbers, links, and spelling.



Comfortable working inside web?based software after training.



Able to follow checklists and processes without skipping steps.



Reliable, responsive, and able to meet agreed deadlines.



Good written English for basic edits and templated review responses.



Nice to have (not required)

Any previous experience working with Google Business Profiles, local businesses, or simple online business listings.



Prior remote/freelance experience following SOPs.



Engagement & how to apply

Full Time



Workload will increase as we onboard more businesses.



Flexible hours as long as tasks are completed on time.



To apply, please send:



A short introduction about yourself and your background.



Any relevant experience working with online business tools or data entry (if you have it).



Your hourly rate and typical weekly availability.

title: Assistenz für Google-Unternehmensprofil?Verwaltung (Freelance, vollständige Einarbeitung)
description:
Wir suchen eine zuverlässige, detailorientierte Freelancer?Kraft, die uns bei der Verwaltung von lokalen Unternehmen in unserer Software für Google Unternehmensprofile unterstützt.



Vorkenntnisse mit No?Code?Tools oder spezieller Software sind nicht erforderlich. Wir stellen eine klare, einfache Einarbeitung sowie Schritt?für?Schritt?Anleitungen zur Verfügung. Deine Hauptaufgabe ist es, die Prozesse sorgfältig in der Software umzusetzen.



Deine Aufgaben

Einloggen in unsere Plattform und Verwaltung mehrerer lokaler Unternehmenskonten.



Aktualisieren von Unternehmensdaten (Name, Adresse, Telefonnummer, Öffnungszeiten, Einzugsgebiete) nach Vorgabe.



Anlegen und Bearbeiten von Beiträgen, Fotos, Dienstleistungen und kurzen Beschreibungen anhand unserer Vorlagen.



Unterstützung beim Bewertungs?Management: mithilfe unserer Textbausteine Antwortvorschläge erstellen und den Status von Bewertungen im System aktualisieren.



Einstellungen und Checklisten pro Kunde in der Software anwenden, damit jedes Profil korrekt konfiguriert ist.



Einfache Dokumentation der erledigten Arbeiten pro Unternehmen (Status?Notizen, Datum, durchgeführte Aktionen).



Was nicht von dir erwartet wird

Kein Programmieren oder technische Entwicklung.



Kein Verkauf, Upselling oder Abschließen von Kunden.



Keine komplexe Marketingstrategie – du folgst klaren Anweisungen und Vorlagen.



Das bieten wir

Vollständige Einarbeitung in die Software und unsere Arbeitsabläufe.



Schriftliche SOPs (Prozessbeschreibungen) und kurze Video?Walkthroughs für jede Aufgabenart.



Laufende Unterstützung und Feedback, damit du sicherer und schneller wirst.



Anforderungen

Sehr hohe Genauigkeit und Sorgfalt – du prüfst Namen, Telefonnummern, Links und Rechtschreibung sorgfältig.



Sicherer Umgang mit webbasierten Anwendungen nach kurzer Einarbeitung.



Fähigkeit, Checklisten und Prozesse Schritt für Schritt abzuarbeiten, ohne Schritte zu überspringen.



Zuverlässigkeit, Verbindlichkeit und Einhaltung vereinbarter Fristen.



Gute schriftliche Deutsch? oder Englischkenntnisse für einfache Textanpassungen und Bewertungsantworten.



Nice to have (kein Muss)

Erste Erfahrung mit Google?Unternehmensprofilen, lokalen Unternehmen oder Online?Branchenverzeichnissen.



Erfahrung im Remote?/Freelance?Bereich mit Arbeiten nach SOPs.



Rahmenbedingungen & Bewerbung

Freiberuflich, Teilzeit, langfristig angelegt.



Das Pensum steigt mit der Anzahl der betreuten Unternehmen.



Flexible Arbeitszeiten, solange die Aufgaben zuverlässig und fristgerecht erledigt werden.



Wenn du Interesse hast, sende bitte:



Eine kurze Vorstellung von dir und deinem Hintergrund.



Ggf. relevante Erfahrung mit Online?Tools oder Datenerfassung.



Deinen Stundensatz und deine typische wöchentliche Verfügbarkeit.



Wenn du strukturierte Arbeit, klare Checklisten und eine langfristige, unkomplizierte Umsetzungsrolle schätzt, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung auf Deutsch da wir mit deutschen Kunden arbeiten und alle Konnetare/Posts in Deutsch schreiben werden.

title: Senior Accountant-Production Manager
description:
Elliott Accounting is a Melbourne-based firm with over 20 years of experience, with offices in Ballarat, Geelong and Daylesford. At Elliott Accounting we take pride in not only the service we provide to our clients, but also the opportunities, enjoyment and fulfillment available to all our tea
mbers as part of their employment.



We are currently seeking a Senior Accountant/Production Manager ready to take the next step in their career at our growing public practice firm. This opportunity is a work from home role with flexibility, we service a diverse range of clients, from individuals to small and medium-sized businesses across various industries.



We are looking for a candidate who is passionate about achieving the best for themselves whilst making a difference and supporting positive outcomes for our clients.



About the role

The role includes but is not limited to:

• Preparation of Income tax returns, financial statements and business activity statements

• Tax Planning, structure review, and business advisory services

• Assisting with the supervision of offshore accounting team

• Supporting Directors and the broader team with ongoing compliance work project

• Building and maintaining relationships with clients

• Liaising with third parties such as ATO, SRO, lending Institutions, legal Services, Brokers, etc

• Assisting & participating in further development of the Practice’s knowledge and skill base.



Desired Skills & Experience of Successful Applicant

• Minimum of 5 years’ experience in Australian practice

• Experience with online bookkeeping software (Xero, MYOB, QuickBooks)

• Experience with FYI desirable but not essential

• Competent understanding and ability to complete financial statements, tax returns, activity statements and financial reports in an autonomous and timely manner

• Solid tax knowledge with the ability to apply it to real-life situations

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

• Excellent communication skills is imperative

• Ability to work in a team and a willingness to learn as well as contribute.



Attractive salary arrangements dependent upon previous experience and competency with scope for further development and growth.



If this position appeals to you or you have any further queries, please don't hesitate to apply or contact us via
 at

title: Replo Expert – Figma to Shopify Implementation (Pixel-Perfect)
description:
We are a fast-growing DTC e-commerce company launching multiple brands across various niches. We provide high-end, completed designs in Figma; we need a technical Replo Developer to bring them to life.



This is a development-only role. We don't need a designer; we need a builder who obsesses over padding, typography, and mobile responsiveness.



Job Details



Rate: $12–$15/hour (depending on experience)

Capacity: ~20 hours per week

Type: Long-term, ongoing projects (Landing Pages, Product Pages, and Homepages)





Key Responsibilities



Execution: Translate Figma files into functional, high-speed Shopify pages using Replo.

Precision: Ensure 100% visual accuracy (pixel-perfect) from Figma to live site across all breakpoints.

Efficiency: Build reusable sections and templates utilizing Shopify Metafields and Dynamic Data.

Performance: Optimize every page for lightning-fast load times and clean structure.





Requirements



Advanced Replo Skills: You must be able to build custom layouts from scratch (no reliance on pre-made templates).

Figma Mastery: Ability to inspect files for exact dimensions, CSS properties, and assets.

Shopify Savvy: Strong understanding of how Replo interacts with the Shopify ecosystem (Liquid logic is a major plus).

Quality Control: A "check twice, cut once" mentality—especially regarding mobile responsiveness.





To Apply

Please use "REPLO-DEV" as your Subject Line and answer the following:



1. Provide 2–3 links to live Shopify pages you have personally built using Replo.

2. Do you build pages manually in Replo or use auto-import plugins? (Note: We require manual builds to ensure clean structure).

3. Confirming you are available for ~20 hours/week for long-term work?

title: Urgent - 1h/day - Competitor Research Assistant (Remote, Part-time)
description:
Who are we?

We are a fast-growing fashion dropshipping company running multiple Shopify stores across Europe, generating over €100,000/month in revenue.

To keep growing, we constantly need fresh competitor data from the market — that’s where you come in.



Role Overview

We’re looking for a Competitor Research Assistant who can spend around 1 hour per day using simple online tools to:



Scroll through Meta Ads Library



Find new fashion competitors in our target markets



Log the right ones into a Google Sheet



This is a very simple, repetitive task — but it’s important for our business. You don’t need advanced skills or experience; you do need to be fast, accurate, and consistent on a computer.



Your main tasks will be:



1. Use Meta Ads Library (we’ll provide the link and guidance)



2. Scroll through ads using our keyword lists and filters



3. Visit the advertised store and quickly understand what type of store it is



4. Identify:



- Fashion dropshipping stores (they sell products we can also find on AliExpress / similar suppliers)



- Real fashion brands that design/produce their own items (we don’t count these as competitors)



5. Log the approved competitors into a Google Sheet with the required details (URL, brand name, notes, etc.)



Use a few Chrome extensions and simple online tools we’ll provide (for example, to check product sources or store details)



We’ll give you clear examples and checklists, so you know exactly what to do.



Key skill: spotting dropshippers vs real brands

Today, many dropshipping stores try to look like “real brands” (thanks to AI, better design, etc.).

Your most important job is to look past the nice design and figure out:



Is this store selling generic products we could likely find on AliExpress or other common suppliers?



Then we count them as competitors.



Or are they clearly a real brand, designing and producing their own unique products? 



Then we do NOT count them as competitors.



We will teach you what to look for, but you must be:



Curious and observant



Willing to follow the logic, not just the “vibe” of the website



What we expect from you

You do NOT need to be an expert in e-commerce. You do need:



A fast and reliable laptop or desktop



Stable internet connection



Comfortable using Chrome, multiple tabs, and Chrome extensions



Basic Google Sheets (copy/paste, fill in rows, no advanced formulas needed)



Fast and accurate when clicking, checking, and logging data



Basic English reading so you can follow instructions and understand websites



Ability to focus on repetitive work without losing accuracy



Reliability: if we agree on 1 hour/day, we expect you to actually show up and do it



Nice to have (but not required):



Any experience with dropshipping, Shopify, AliExpress, or Meta Ads Library



What we offer 



100% remote – work from anywhere



~1 hour per day (7 days/week or 5 days/week – we’ll agree together)



Pay: $2 per hour (simple and repetitive task) + Bonuses



Possibility to get more hours in the future if we work well together



Training provided – we’ll show you exactly how to do the job



Simple, clear, step-by-step tasks



How to apply

Please apply in English and include:



A short introduction about yourself (1–3 sentences).



Your laptop/PC specs (how old it is and if it runs fast with many tabs).



A brief example of any repetitive or data-entry task you’ve done before (if any).



In 2–3 sentences, tell us how you would try to understand if a fashion store is a real brand or a dropshipping store, just based on looking at their website.



Please use this subject line / title:

"Market Scraper – [Your Name]"



We may start with a short paid trial (for example, 30–60 minutes of scraping) to see how you work and how well you follow the guidelines.

title: AI Social Media Manager Needed
description:
Hello there!



We are a growing Marketing Agency with multiple e-commerce stores looking for an enthusiastic and professional Social Media Manager.



This role is a part-time role where you will be working with our current team of 8.



Here is an example page that we are looking to make and manage: 







We need someone who has a decent understanding of marketing and is able to put the information given into an attractive post and manage it for us.



As well as create reels that can help us grow.



We are an AI-forward team and actively use tools like Claude for copywriting, brainstorming, and ideation, as well as Nano Banana Pro for AI image generation.



We expect our Social Media Manager to be comfortable leveraging these tools to speed up workflows, generate compelling copy, create visuals, and come up with fresh content ideas.



If you already have experience using AI tools in your creative process, that is a huge plus.



Requirements:



* Minimum 2-year social media management experience



* Must be proficient in English



* Know how to use Slack for communications



* Must be comfortable using AI tools such as Claude and Nano Banana Pro as part of your daily workflow



* Ability to use AI-generated copy and images as a starting point and refine them to match brand voice and quality standards



Your tasks as a manager will include:



1. Make posts based on the information we give you — 4 carousel posts per week and 2 story posts per week



2. Come up with ideas for posts that we can do and manage them on the account yourself



3. Look for ways to grow the account even more



4. Use Claude to assist with writing captions, brainstorming content angles, and drafting copy for posts and stories



5. Use Nano Banana Pro to generate on-brand images and visuals for posts when needed



6. Continuously explore new ways AI tools can improve our content quality and output speed



We ask that you answer the questions below to help us get to know you.



Questions:



1. Have you made social media management posts before?



2. Do you have any examples of your work we can see? If so, please link it below (Product Preferred).



3. How long would it take you to think of a post idea based on a post we gave and make it?



4. Can you work flexible hours during the morning?



5. Can you commit to at least 3 months if selected?



6. Do you have any questions about the job/job description?



7. Have you worked for a Marketing agency or e-commerce team before?



8. Have you used AI tools like Claude or ChatGPT for copywriting or content ideation? If so, please describe how you've used them in your workflow.



9. Have you used any AI image generation tools such as Nano Banana Pro, Midjourney, or similar? If so, please share an example or describe your experience.



10. If we gave you a product photo and a few bullet points about a promotion, walk us through how you would use AI tools to turn that into a finished carousel post.



We are looking to grow very quickly in the next few months and this position will allow for opportunities to be moved to incentive-based pay and a salary increase.



We ask that if you do provide examples, that it be examples relevant to what the job describes.



Biweekly Pay: $150 CAD + BONUS



Hours: 2-3 Hours Per day, some days you won't need to work :)



Currently, you must be able to work at least 14hrs/week (including weekends)



*** HOW TO APPLY ***



*You must include your favorite color in the subject line of your application for it to be considered (this shows you actually read it and is very important).



1.) Send us a message answering our 10 questions



2.) Include examples of your work



---



I updated the question count reference from 7 to 10 to match the new total, added three new AI-focused questions (8–10), expanded the requirements and task list to reflect the AI tooling expectations, and included context about your team being AI-forward. Let me know if you'd like any tweaks.

title: AI specialist needed (Claude, Gemeni, etc)
description:
Hello there!



We are a growing Marketing Agency with multiple e-commerce stores looking for a knowledgeable and forward-thinking AI Automation Specialist.



This role is a part-time role where you will be working with our current team of 8.



We are an AI-forward company that already uses tools like Claude for copywriting and ideation and Nano Banana Pro for AI image generation across our workflows.



We need someone who lives and breathes AI — someone who is constantly on top of the latest tools, trends, and updates in the AI space and knows how to implement them into a real business.



Your job will be to find new AI tools, test them, and figure out exactly how they can save us time, improve our output, and help us scale faster.



If you're the type of person who gets excited every time a new AI tool drops and immediately thinks about how it could be used in a business setting, this role is for you.



Requirements:



* Minimum 1-year experience working with AI tools in a professional or freelance capacity



* Must be proficient in English



* Know how to use Slack for communications



* Deep understanding of the current AI landscape including tools for automation, copywriting, image generation, video generation, workflow building, and data analysis



* Experience with automation platforms such as Make, Zapier, n8n, or similar



* Ability to clearly explain and document new tools and processes for a non-technical team



* Must be a self-starter who actively researches and stays ahead of AI trends without being told to



Your tasks as an AI Automation Specialist will include:



1. Research and identify new AI tools and trends on a weekly basis and report findings to the team



2. Test and evaluate AI tools to determine which ones are worth integrating into our workflows



3. Build and implement AI-powered automations that save the team time across content creation,
 marketing, social media, and e-commerce operations



4. Optimize our current use of tools like Claude and Nano Banana Pro and find ways to get even more out of them



5. Create simple SOPs and walkthroughs so that the rest of the team can use the tools and automations you build



6. Stay plugged into AI communities, newsletters, and forums so we are always ahead of the curve



7. Identify opportunities where AI can replace or speed up manual tasks across all areas of the business



We ask that you answer the questions below to help us get to know you.



Questions:



1. How long have you been actively working with AI tools in a professional or business setting?



2. Do you have any examples of automations or AI workflows you've built? If so, please link or describe them below.



3. What AI tools are you currently using on a regular basis? Please list them and briefly describe what you use each one for.



4. What automation platforms have you worked with (e.g., Make, Zapier, n8n, etc.)?



5. Can you give us an example of a time you discovered a new AI tool and implemented it into a workflow that saved time or improved results?



6. If we told you we spend 5 hours a week manually writing
 campaigns for our e-commerce stores, how would you approach automating or improving that process using AI?



7. How do you stay up to date on AI trends and new tool releases? What communities, newsletters, or resources do you follow?



8. Can you work flexible hours during the morning?



9. Can you commit to at least 3 months if selected?



10. Do you have any questions about the job/job description?



We are looking to grow very quickly in the next few months and this position will allow for opportunities to be moved to incentive-based pay and a salary increase.



We ask that if you do provide examples, that it be examples relevant to what the job describes.



Biweekly Pay: $200 CAD + BONUS



Hours: 2-3 Hours Per day, some days you won't need to work :)



Currently, you must be able to work at least 14hrs/week (including weekends)



*** HOW TO APPLY ***



*You must include your favorite color in the subject line of your application for it to be considered (this shows you actually read it and is very important).



1.) Send us a message answering our 10 questions



2.) Include examples of your work (automations, workflows, SOPs, or case studies preferred)



---

title: SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We’re hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflo

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

 Ads and Google Ads for real estate acquisition

 & Google Ads for real estate

description:

Your Top Tasks

*Make YouTube thumbnails (simple, clear designs – I provide face poses)

*Monitor and moderate an online community on 
 (remove spam, surface wins)

*Check Instagram DMs, TikTok DMs, and
 daily and reply using my scripts

*Research video ideas from comments and competitor channels

*Strong English (written and spoken)

*Can learn new skills fast

Pay & Perks

* Flexible vacation – if you need time off, just let me know in advance

How to Apply (Follow Exactly)

 to interview you, there will be a short Zoom call and video will be required.



Thank you,

James Lu

title: Outbound Caller (AU Leads) — Survey Calls (Recorded) | Project-Based
description:
We’re looking for a reliable outbound caller to contact our existing leads (and source more leads if needed) and complete a short survey over the phone.



Goal: Achieve 15 completed calls where the person answers the survey questions (calls count as “completed” only if the survey is answered).



What you’ll do



Call our lead list (we’ll provide it)



Speak with the owner/manager/admin and ask survey questions



Log answers exactly as said (verbatim where possible)



If we run short on reachable contacts, source additional leads and continue calling



Track call outcomes (no answer, wrong number, call back, not interested, etc.)



Important note about recording



All calls are recorded for quality and training purposes. By applying, you acknowledge you’re comfortable working in a recorded-call environment.



Requirements



Confident spoken English (clear and professional)



Comfortable making outbound calls and handling basic objections



Strong note-taking + accurate data entry



Reliable internet + quiet calling environment



Bonus: experience calling Australian businesses / using VoIP tools



Deliverables



15 completed survey calls



A filled-in tracker with:



who answered (owner/manager/admin)



lead source (if known)

title: Bookkeeper (E-Commerce)
description:
About the Role:

Brands Capital Group is looking for a detail-oriented Bookkeeper to manage accurate financial records across our multi-platform e-commerce operations (Shopify, Amazon, eBay, and more). This is a fully remote, full-time position reporting to Finance Manager.



What You'll Do:

Record and categorize daily sales transactions across multiple platforms

Process refunds, cancellations, and chargebacks

Track payment gateway fees (PayPal, Stripe, Square)

Reconcile bank accounts, credit cards, and payment processors daily/weekly

Manage accounts payable & receivable, including vendor invoices and COGS tracking

Generate monthly P&L statements, balance sheets, and cash flow reports

Track sales tax/VAT by jurisdiction and ensure multi-jurisdiction compliance

Monitor inventory costs, product margins, and identify cost-saving opportunities

Prepare quarterly tax documents and year-end reports





Requirements:

Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

3–5 years of bookkeeping/accounting experience, preferably in e-commerce or retail

Proficiency in QuickBooks Online, Xero, or similar accounting software

Strong understanding of Shopify, Amazon, eBay financial reporting

Experience with PayPal, Stripe, Square reconciliation

Knowledge of sales tax/VAT and multi-jurisdiction compliance



Nice to Have:

Certified Bookkeeper designation

Experience with A2X, Link My Books, or Synder

GAAP knowledge and accrual accounting experience





What We Offer:

Fully remote setup

Competitive salary

Long-term growth within a fast-growing e-commerce team

Creative ownership and room for innovation





How to Apply:

To be considered for this role, please complete our application form. Note: Only applicants who complete the form will be processed.



Apply here:

title: Amazon Brand Manager
description:
We’re looking for a performance-driven Amazon Brand Manager to own and grow our presence across multiple Amazon storefronts. If you thrive in fast-paced e-commerce environments, know Amazon inside and out, and can juggle strategy, execution, and analysis across several brands simultaneously, this role is for you.



Responsibilities:



Multistorefront Management: Own and scale 5+ Amazon storefronts, ensuring consistent brand voice, high-quality visuals, and fully optimized listings.

Launch & Promo Strategy: Plan and execute product launches, promotions, and seasonal campaigns to maximize visibility and sales.

Performance Monitoring: Track storefront KPIs (sales, traffic, conversion, advertising ROI), customer feedback, and competitor moves—turn insights into actionable strategies.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Coordinate with creative, PPC, inventory, and logistics teams to align messaging, stock, and advertising.

Compliance & Trends: Stay up-to-date with Amazon algorithm updates, policies, and marketplace trends to maintain optimal visibility and compliance.

Listing Optimization: Implement Amazon SEO best practices—optimize titles, bullets, descriptions, keywords, and A+ content.

UX & Conversion: Lead storefront UX improvements, A/B tests, and creative updates to boost conversion and engagement.

Reporting: Produce regular dashboards and reports summarizing performance and recommending next steps for growth.



Requirements:



Proven experience managing 5+ Amazon storefronts simultaneously.

3+ years in Amazon brand management, e-commerce, or digital marketing.

Deep knowledge of Amazon Seller Central, Brand Registry, A+ / Premium A+ content, and Amazon SEO.

Analytical mindset with demonstrated success in improving sales, conversion rates, and advertising ROI.

Comfortable using keyword research and listing-optimization tools; adept at data interpretation and strategic planning.

Strong project-management, communication, and cross-functional collaboration skills.

Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive in problem-solving.

Experience with Helium 10, Jungle Scout, DataHawk, or similar analytics suites is a plus.

Familiarity with Amazon DSP or external traffic/acquisition strategies is a plus.

Graphic-design chops or oversight experience for creative production is a plus.

Knowledge of international Amazon marketplaces (UK, EU, CA, etc.) is a plus.

title: Amazon Sourcing Specialist
description:
We’re seeking a detail-oriented and cost-conscious Purchasing/Sourcing Specialist to manage and optimize supplier relationships for our Amazon private-label and marketplace operations. You will lead supplier sourcing and negotiation, build landed cost models, and manage execution across samples, POs, freight, and replenishment. The ideal candidate combines sharp cost analysis with operational rigor — ensuring supply chain flows smoothly to FBA/3PL while hitting margin and targets.



Responsibilities:



Source, vet, and onboard manufacturers; run RFQs and negotiate pricing, MOQ, lead times, and payment terms

Build and maintain accurate landed cost models, factoring in duties, freight, and FBA fees to achieve margin goals

Coordinate product samples, specs, labeling, packaging, and regulatory compliance for Amazon and category standards

Create and track POs from production through delivery; ensure on-time, in-full (OTIF) performance from suppliers and carriers

Track vendor performance on cost, quality, lead time, and defect rate; lead corrective actions as needed

Conduct supplier audits and risk assessments, including geopolitical, compliance, and capacity considerations

Drive cost-saving initiatives through negotiation, packaging optimization, freight consolidation, or alternate sourcing

Support continuous improvement in sourcing processes and supplier performance



Requirements:



3+ years in purchasing, sourcing, or supply chain — ideally for Amazon FBA or e-commerce businesses

Proven experience negotiating with overseas factories, including MOQs, pricing, and payment terms

Solid understanding of landed cost analysis, profit margins, and Amazon’s fee structures

Working knowledge of quality control checkpoints and regulatory product compliance

Advanced Excel or Google Sheets skills; familiarity with PO systems

Strong organization, documentation, and multi-SKU project management ability

Proactive problem-solver who can work autonomously in a fast-paced, remote environment

Familiarity with sourcing and market tools like Helium 10 or Keepa is preferred

Experience with EDI, inventory planning, or demand forecasting is preferred

Category experience in regulated goods such as home improvement products or replacement parts is a plus

Exposure to total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis in sourcing decisions is a plus

title: Amazon Catalog Manager
description:
Job Summary:



We’re seeking an experienced Amazon Catalog Manager to own end-to-end listing health and performance for a large SKU portfolio. You’ll manage backend attributes and compliance, optimize front-end content, and analyze key metrics to improve rankings, conversion, and revenue. Ideal for a data-driven operator with deep Seller Central expertise and a track record scaling large catalogs.



Responsibilities:



Catalog Management



Maintain and optimize 500+ SKUs in Seller Central, ensuring accurate categories, browse nodes, variations, and buy box–relevant settings.



Execute monthly content audits (titles, bullets, images, A+), fix suppressions/stranded inventory, and uphold Amazon TOS and compliance.



Manage backend attributes (search terms, item type keywords, intended use, target audience) and ensure listing data integrity.



Sales & Ranking Optimization



Track keyword rankings, CVR, pricing, and subcategory BSR; set weekly sales targets and target BSR per ASIN.



Identify underperforming listings and implement remediation plans (content, offers, pricing/ coupons, deals, images, reviews strategy inputs).



Monitor profitability and contribution margins, coordinating with ads and pricing to hit goals.



Insights & Collaboration



Partner with internal teams on pricing, promotions, creative, and inventory to align levers with growth targets.



Run competitive audits (content, offers, reviews, price moves) and recommend tactical adjustments.



Build and deliver actionable, data-driven performance reports and dashboards.



Requirements:



4+ years hands-on experience in Amazon Seller Central (required).



Proven success managing large catalogs (500+ SKUs) with complex variations.



Advanced Excel/Google Sheets (lookups, pivots, data cleaning).



Expert knowledge of listing optimization, keyword research/strategy, and backend attributes.



Strong grasp of Amazon TOS, compliance, suppressions, and listing health mechanics.



Familiarity with Sellerboard, Keepa, DataRova (or similar) is a plus.



Fluent English; highly organized, analytical, and self-directed.



Committed to a single full-time role.

nts

Strong storytelling instincts with a clear focus on hooks and retention

Data-informed creative mindset with a focus on performance over vanity metrics

title: Influencer Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:



We are seeking an Influencer Coordinator / Affiliate Outreach Coordinator to support and scale a fast-growing brand’s affiliate and creator partnerships. This role focuses on building strong relationships with creators, managing ongoing campaigns, tracking performance, and ensuring timely execution across deliverables, payments, and content documentation. - Monitor trends and patterns across social and digital marketing efforts to identify new opportunities

, and

- Assist in creating influencer briefs, one-pagers, and campaign documentation aligned with marketing objectives

- Collaborate with design and content teams to support the creation of high-quality social and creator-led content



Requirements:

- Minimum of 3 years of experience in influencer coordination, affiliate outreach, or a related role

- Strong expertise across major social media platforms, particularly Instagram and TikTok

- Solid understanding of marketing metrics and the ability to analyze performance data and KPIs

- Experience with editorial and social media content development, with a foundational understanding of digital design and user experience principles

- Proven track record of successfully managing and scaling influencer or affiliate programs

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail

- Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple creators and deadlines simultaneously

- Experience working in a high-growth or startup environment; SaaS or B2B experience is a strong plus

title: Ecommerce Inventory & Merchandising Specialist - Australian Retailer
description:
Job title: Ecommerce Inventory & Merchandising Specialist (Interim)

Department: Ecommerce

Reporting to: Ecommerce Manager

Hours: Full time (Short-term contract)

Location: Remote

Start Date: March 2026

Mon-Friday 9am-5pm AEST

Weekly Payment US$262



Role Overview

The Ecommerce Inventory & Merchandising Specialist (Interim) is responsible for maintaining business continuity across eCommerce operations during a transitional period.

This role focuses on day-to-day inventory management, product enrichment, reporting, and onsite merchandising execution to ensure seamless trading performance across Shopify. Working closely with Ecommerce, Planning, Marketing, Operations, and Finance teams, this position ensures stock accuracy, product data integrity, reporting visibility, and strong site execution.



The role requires hands-on Shopify and SAP experience, strong analytical capability, and a proactive approach to managing stock flow, reporting, and site merchandising.





Role Responsibilities & KPIs

RESPONSIBILITY 1 – Inventory Management

The Ecommerce Inventory & Merchandising Specialist will oversee inventory integrity and stock performance across the Shopify store, ensuring accurate stock levels, visibility, and reporting.

Tasks include (but are not limited to):

- Managing stock on hand levels across Shopify and SAP

- Monitoring sell-through, weeks of cover, and stock health

- Identifying and escalating out-of-stock risks and overstock risks

- Producing and maintaining out-of-stock reports

- Producing stock on hand and stock health reports

- Supporting replenishment and back-in-stock processes

- Ensuring accurate stock sync between SAP and Shopify

- Supporting demand planning insights where required



Work standard / Expectation / KPI:

- Daily stock monitoring and reconciliation

- Out-of-stock report updated and distributed weekly

- 100% stock accuracy between Shopify and SAP

- OOS risks identified and escalated proactively

- Reporting delivered on time and with 99%+ accuracy



RESPONSIBILITY 2 – Product Enrichment & Data Integrity

This role is responsible for maintaining high-quality product information and ensuring best-practice PDP execution.

Tasks include (but are not limited to):

- Creating and maintaining product listings in Shopify

- Managing product descriptions, imagery, tags, and specifications

- Ensuring product categorisation and collection rules are accurate

- Managing metafields and Shopify apps relevant to product display

- Troubleshooting product or data discrepancies

- Collaborating with Creative and Marketing teams on content updates

- Supporting product launches and promotional setups



Work standard / Expectation / KPI:

- All new products uploaded accurately prior to launch deadlines

- 100% PDP compliance with brand guidelines

- Zero broken links or incorrect product data

- Product updates completed within agreed timeframes



RESPONSIBILITY 3 – Reporting & Analytics

- Updating homepage and collection merchandising

- Managing collection sort rules and merchandising logic

- Supporting promotional setups and site campaigns

- Coordinating content updates aligned to marketing calendar

- Supporting sale events and seasonal transitions



Work standard / Expectation / KPI:

- All campaign content executed on time

- Site reflects current trading priorities at all times

- Merchandising supports conversion and sell-through

- Zero broken collections or mis-tagged products

title: Bookkeeper (Remote – UK Accounting Firm)
description:
To proceed with your application further, please fill out this form: 



About Sidekick



Sidekick is a UK Chartered Accountancy firm specialising in fast-growing marketing and digital agencies. We operate a pod-based delivery model with clear roles, defined processes, and strong review standards.



We're hiring a Bookkeeper to support our Accountants with day-to-day bookkeeping across a portfolio of UK clients.



This is a delivery-focused role designed for someone early in their bookkeeping career who wants to build strong fundamentals in a structured practice environment.



This role is fully remote and home-based.



The Role



As a Bookkeeper, you'll be responsible for completing day-to-day bookkeeping tasks and preparing work to a high standard for review by an Accountant.

- Your focus is on accuracy, completeness, and following processes carefully. You will not be responsible for final outputs or full client ownership.

- You'll work closely with an Accountant, receive clear instructions and feedback, and gradually take on more responsibility as your capability and confidence grow.

- You are able to commit to working in this position on a full-time basis.



Key Responsibilities



- You will process day-to-day bookkeeping using Xero, including bank and credit card reconciliations, invoice processing, expense coding, and posting journals.

- You will ensure transactions are coded accurately and that supporting documentation is complete, correctly attached, and easy to review.

- You will follow up with clients when information or clarification is needed, using clear and professional communication. You will also act on routine client requests, such as raising invoices or chasing payments, following defined processes.

- You will prepare bookkeeping work for review, ensuring files are tidy, reconciled, and ready for month-end close.

- You will follow established SOPs and checklists, flag issues or uncertainties early, and correct errors promptly based on feedback.

- You will support VAT preparation and month-end processes by ensuring the underlying bookkeeping is accurate and complete.



 What Good Looks Like:



- Transactions are coded accurately and consistently

- Client communication is clear, professional, and timely

- Files are tidy, organised, and review-ready

- Errors reduce over time as feedback is applied

- Deadlines are met without reminders

- Accountants trust your work and don't need to re-do it

- You ask questions early rather than guessing



Ideal Background (Essential)



We are looking for a bookkeeper who is reliable, organised, and keen to learn.



You must have:



- 2 years' experience in an accounting or bookkeeping role (practice experience preferred but not required)

- Hands-on experience using Xero

- Strong understanding of bookkeeping principles, including debits, credits, reconciliations, and posting journals

- Good attention to detail and willingness to follow processes

- Clear written English and professional communication skills

- Ability to work UK hours reliably

- You are able to commit to working in this position on a full-time basis.



Nice to Have:



- Studying towards CPA or equivalent qualification

- Experience working with UK, US, or Australian clients

- Experience in a practice or shared-services environment

- Exposure to VAT or month-end processes\



Working Hours



UK hours required:** 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM PH time, Monday to Friday (with breaks)



What You'll Get



- Competitive starting salary: ?30,000 – ?40,000 PHP

- 20 days paid leave plus Philippine holidays

- Fully remote, long-term role

- Structured training and review process

- Clear progression path to Accountant for high performers



How to Apply

Apply via the link below:

title: Executive Assistant to President — Logistics
description:
We are a fast-growing logistics group headquartered in New Jersey, USA. Our companies LDP Logistics and Gravitas International Logistics provide freight brokerage, ocean forwarding, and customs brokerage services across the United States and international trade corridors. We operate with teams in New Jersey, Pakistan, and India.

We hold federal licenses including FMCSA broker authority, FMC ocean transportation intermediary, and CBP customs broker licenses. We are scaling aggressively and leverage AI-powered workflows to punch well above our weight class. If you want to grow with a company that moves fast, rewards ownership, and uses cutting-edge tools, this is for you.



Role Overview



We are looking for a sharp, organized, and proactive Executive Assistant to support the President directly across multiple business entities. This is not a data-entry role. You will be the operational right hand—managing communications, coordinating across teams in the US, Pakistan, and India, handling research, preparing documents, and keeping everything running on time. You will work closely with AI tools (including Claude, ChatGPT, and custom AI workflows) as part of your daily toolkit.



Key Responsibilities

Executive & Calendar Management

• Manage and optimize a complex calendar across multiple time zones (US, Pakistan, India, UAE)

• Screen, prioritize, and draft responses for
 across multiple inboxes

• Prepare agendas, briefs, and follow-up action items for meetings

• Coordinate travel arrangements and itineraries

Operations & Project Coordination

• Track deliverables and deadlines across logistics and tech projects

• Coordinate between US-based leadership, Karachi-based operations team, and India-based sales team

• Maintain and update SOPs, playbooks, org charts, and internal documentation

• Manage CRM entries, carrier and client data, and pipeline tracking

Research, Documents & Communications

• Conduct market research, competitive intelligence, and prospect research

• Draft professional
s, proposals, pitch decks, and client-facing documents

• Prepare presentations and reports for investor meetings and business development

• Monitor industry news and flag relevant opportunities or risks

AI & Technology Integration

• Use AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT) daily for research, drafting, data analysis, and workflow automation

• Help manage and populate Claude Projects with relevant company information

• Assist in building and maintaining automated workflows and SOPs

• Proactively suggest process improvements using available technology



Requirements

Must-Have

• 3+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant, Virtual Assistant, or Operations Coordinator

• Excellent written and spoken English (C1/C2 level minimum)

• Highly organized with strong attention to detail and ability to manage competing priorities

• Available to work US Eastern Time hours (9 AM – 6 PM EST, with flexibility)

• Proficient in Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, and project management tools (Asana, Notion, or similar)

• Comfortable with AI tools — willingness to learn and use Claude/ChatGPT daily is non-negotiable

• Strong communication skills — you can represent the company professionally in written correspondence

• Self-starter who takes initiative without waiting to be told what to do

Nice-to-Have (Will Set You Apart)

• Experience in logistics, freight brokerage, supply chain, or international trade

• Familiarity with CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce, or industry-specific tools)

• Experience with bookkeeping or basic financial reporting

• Background supporting C-suite or multi-entity business owners

• Knowledge of US customs or regulatory processes

• Experience with AI prompt engineering or workflow automation



Compensation & Benefits

Salary

$800 – $1,500 USD/month (based on experience)

Schedule

Full-time, US Eastern hours (Mon–Fri)

Location

100% Remote

Paid Leave

Vacation, holidays, and sick days included

Growth

Performance-based raises + expanded responsibilities

Tools Provided

Access to premium AI tools, software licenses, and training

Culture

Small team, big ambition. Direct access to the President daily.

 

How to Apply



To apply, please send the following:

1. Your updated resume/CV

2. A brief cover letter (3–5 sentences) explaining why you are the right fit for this role

3. Your available start date

4. Answer this question in 2–3 sentences: "Describe a time you used technology or a tool to solve a problem faster than doing it manually."

title: Shopify Developer (Theme + Liquid) — Build Pages From Figma/Wireframes (Long-Term)
description:
About Plant collective Digital



Plant collective Digital is an ecommerce growth agency working with multiple Shopify brands. We’re looking for a high-skill Shopify developer who can rebuild/implement designs from Figma wireframes and screenshots with strong engineering standards, not “quick hacks”.



This is a long-term role for someone who wants an ongoing relationship. If you’re a fit, you’ll get consistent work across multiple client stores.



What You’ll Do



Reproduce Shopify storefront pages from Figma wireframes + screenshots with high fidelity



Implement sections and components in Shopify Liquid (Online Store 2.0)



Work inside an existing theme (often Dawn-based) and extend it cleanly



Ensure responsive layout accuracy across desktop + mobile



Follow best practices for:



performance (page speed, clean DOM, minimal bloat)



accessibility (semantic HTML, keyboard + screen reader basics)



maintainability (reusable sections/snippets, clean naming, comments)



QA your work thoroughly before delivery (no surprises in production)



Example Design File (You’ll Be Building From)



Figma link: 



We’ll also provide screenshot references + examples of sites/components we want you to match.



Must-Have Skills



Strong Shopify theme development experience (Liquid, JSON templates, sections, snippets)



Solid front-end fundamentals: HTML/CSS, responsive layout, JS (vanilla is fine)



Comfortable building from Figma (spacing, typography, layout details)



Good judgement: you know when to use theme settings vs hard-coded values



Git comfort (basic branching/commits), or at minimum structured file/version control habits



Nice-to-Have



Experience optimizing Core Web Vitals / performance in Shopify themes



Experience with Shopify app integrations and avoiding conflicts



Familiarity with Dawn architecture + Online Store 2.0 patterns



How We Work



We’ll provide:



Figma wireframes + screenshots



a clear task list + success criteria



references/examples to match



You deliver:



clean, working implementation



a short Loom walkthrough (what you changed + where)



confirmation of QA checks completed



QA Expectations (Non-Negotiable)



You must test:



Mobile + desktop layout



Cross-browser basics (Chrome + Safari baseline)



Add-to-cart / variant selection / critical interactions (if applicable)



No console errors



No broken layout at common breakpoints (375px, 768px, 1024px+)



What We Need From You (Application Requirements)



Please include:



3–5 Shopify stores you’ve coded (not just “configured”)



Specify what you built (PDP, sections, custom templates, etc.)



A short description of your Shopify theme workflow



Your hourly rate (or per-project preference) + weekly availability



Confirm you can build from Figma with high accuracy



Your timezone + typical working hours



Bonus: share a GitHub, portfolio, or code sample.



Employment Details



Remote



Part-time to start (ramp up to more hours if it’s a fit)



Long-term ongoing work available for successful candidates



Closing



If you’re the kind of developer who takes pride in clean Shopify builds and can turn Figma into pixel-tight, production-ready storefront sections, apply with your examples.

title: Partnerships Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a Partnerships Specialist who’s equal parts relationship-builder and operator. You’ll find and recruit creators on Instagram, TikTok (and occasionally YouTube), seed product to generate high-quality organic content, and unlock whitelisting/paid usage rights so the best creator content can scale through ads. You’ll also support our affiliate + creator commerce ecosystem (Current, ShopMy, Impact, Rakuten) and help turn partnerships into a repeatable growth channel.



You’ll collaborate closely with Marketing (Paid Social, Brand, Creative), Ecom, and Operations to run a clean end-to-end process: scouting ? outreach ? contracting/permissions ? seeding ? briefing ? content delivery ? whitelisting ? reporting ? relationship nurture.



What you’ll own

Creator sourcing + outreach

Identify creators that match our target audiences (demographics, psychographics, interests, and purchase intent).

Build creator lists for specific campaigns, niches, and evergreen needs (e.g., “on-your-feet” workers, commuters, travelers, etc.).

Pitch creators with clear value exchange (product, paid, affiliate commission, content exposure,

long-term partnership).



Seeding + campaign execution (organic content)

Run product seeding programs at scale: shipping coordination, tracking, follow-ups, and content collection.

Write creator briefs that are simple, on-brand, and performance-aware (strong hooks, key talking points, do/don’t, timelines, deliverables).

Ensure creators deliver content aligned to brand standards while still feeling native to their channel.



Whitelisting + paid usage rights

Secure whitelisting permissions and paid usage rights for top content (Meta + TikTok) and ensure proper documentation.

Coordinate with Paid Social to hand off assets, authorization details, and structured notes (angle, audience, performance expectations).

Maintain an organized library of whitelisted assets and permissions (usage duration, territories, platforms, paid/organic allowances).



Affiliate + creator commerce operations

Support affiliate and creator commerce workflows across:

-Current (creator affiliate / tracking workflows)

-ShopMy (creator storefronts + product linking)

-Impact / Rakuten (affiliate networks, partner onboarding, links, tracking, basic troubleshooting)

-GRIN (creator CRM, outreach, gifting, workflow management, asset tracking)

Help onboard partners, maintain links/codes, and coordinate product feeds/catalog updates where needed.

Monitor partner compliance (discount use, claims, tracking hygiene).



Reporting + optimization

Track and report monthly performance across:

-Creator content output + content quality

-Whitelisting adoption + ad performance signals (CTR, CPA/MER contribution where applicable)

-Affiliate performance (clicks, CVR, revenue, AOV, new customers where available)

Pull insights from platform analytics and internal reporting to improve:

-Creator selection

-Brief quality

-Offer structure (seeding vs paid vs affiliate)

-Content angles that convert



Relationship management

Build long-term creator relationships with consistent communication, fast follow-ups, and clear expectations.

Develop a “bench” of creators you can activate quickly for evergreen needs and seasonal campaigns.

Maintain partner notes, history, and next steps in the CRM.



What success looks like (example KPIs)

Consistent pipeline of qualified creators added weekly/monthly.

Reliable content engine: steady flow of usable organic UGC (volume + quality).

Increasing share of creator content approved for whitelisting and actually used in paid.

Improving paid performance from creator assets over time (creative testing velocity + winners).

Growing affiliate/creator commerce contribution (revenue, new customers, efficiency).

High operational quality: on-time delivery, clean permissions tracking, low breakage.



Requirements

1–3+ years experience in influencer/creator partnerships, affiliate partnerships, or social-first community growth (brand or agency).

Strong understanding of Instagram + TikTok creator ecosystem (formats, trends, what performs).

Comfortable running campaigns end-to-end: outreach ? negotiating ? shipping/seeding ? follow-ups ? reporting.

Familiar with (or excited to learn) tools like GRIN, Current, ShopMy, and affiliate networks

(Impact, Rakuten).

Clear written communication: outreach that gets replies, briefs that creators actually follow.

Highly organized: you can manage many creators and moving parts without drops.

Data-literate: can interpret performance and turn it into action (not just report numbers).



Nice to have

Hands-on experience with whitelisting processes:

-Meta Business Manager access flows, ad account permissions, usage terms

-TikTok creator authorization / Spark-style ad permissions (platfor
chanics vary)

Experience in affiliate operations (linking, codes, attribution basics, partner approvals).

Basic contract/terms comfort: deliverables, deadlines, usage rights, exclusivity, FTC disclosures.

Creator content editing sense (what’s “ad-ready, ” what hook/structure is missing, what to request in revisions).



Core skills & traits

Relationship builder with strong follow-through

Taste + creative instinct (knows what “good” looks like)

Operator mindset (process, checklists, documentation)

Negotiation + boundary-setting (clear terms, timelines, and expectations)

Curious and trend-aware without chasing noise



Day-to-day tools you’ll likely use

GRIN (creator CRM + workflows)

Current and/or ShopMy (creator monetization + tracking)

Impact / Rakuten (affiliate onboarding, links, reporting)

Google Sheets + Slack + Clickup (tracking and project management)

title: Executive Virtual Assistant – Job Applications Manager & Executive Support (Long-Term) for Product Designer
description:
Job Description

I am currently hiring a Long-Term Virtual Assistant to support me in completing job applications and then supporting my daily responsibilities as a Senior Product Designer based in the United States (after I land my new job).

This is NOT a basic data entry role. I am looking for a highly organized, intelligent, and proactive assistant who can help manage job applications, organization systems, research, and ongoing administrative tasks.

Read the full description carefully. If interested, submit your application using the instructions below.



Compensation & Hours

Starting Rate: $5/hour

Hours: 10–20 hours per week

Long-term opportunity (hours may increase over time)

Performance-based raises as trust and responsibilities grow



Training & Workflow (Important)

I will provide detailed training using Loom videos that explain:

My exact job application system

Templates and workflows

Tools and organization methods

You will be expected to learn from SOP videos and operate independently after training. I value problem-solvers who do NOT require constant supervision, and can be proactive.



Primary Responsibilities (Phase 1 – Job Application Management)

You will be responsible for executing a structured job application system targeting Senior Product Designer roles:

Apply to jobs on LinkedIn, company websites, and job boards

Follow my trained system (via Loom videos)

Track 100% of applications in Google Sheets

Customize answers and cover letters using templates

Use AI tools and automation tools (training provided)

Maintain organized documentation and weekly reports

Target Output (After Training):

10 long-form applications per week

50 standard applications

150 LinkedIn Easy Apply submissions

300 AI-assisted applications using approved tools

Quality, accuracy, and organization are more important than blind speed. I will provide the necessary tools to complete this step efficiently. 



Future Responsibilities (Long-Term Growth)

As trust grows, responsibilities may include:

Project management & task tracking

Research (companies, roles, competitors)

Organization systems (Notion, dashboards, trackers)

 & calendar assistance

Personal assistant tasks (light coordination & scheduling)

Administrative support related to Product Design work

Portfolio and job search organization support



Ideal Candidate

Excellent written and spoken English (VERY IMPORTANT)

2+ years experience as a Virtual Assistant (preferred)

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Strong problem-solving skills

Able to follow SOPs and Loom training independently

Proactive mindset (does not ask repetitive basic questions)

Reliable, trustworthy, and professional

Interest in tech, startups, or Product Design is a BIG PLUS

Experience supporting busy professionals or executives is highly preferred



Useful Skills (Bonus but not required)

Project Management tools (Notion, ClickUp, Trello, Asana)

Google Sheets / Excel organization

Research and data organization

Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, automation tools)

Familiarity with LinkedIn and job platforms

Basic understanding of Product Design or UX (a plus)



Opportunities for Growth

This is a long-term role. I am looking for someone I can work with for years, not weeks.

Over time, you will gain experience in:

Working directly with a Senior Product Designer

Organization systems & workflows

AI tools and automation processes

Project management and executive assistance

High performers will receive increased hours, higher pay, and expanded responsibilities.



Application Instructions (VERY IMPORTANT – REQUIRED TEST)

To be considered for an interview, you MUST submit a Loom video (2–5 minutes) answering:

Introduce yourself and your VA experience

How do you help busy professionals stay organized?

What project management or organization tools do you like to use?

Describe a time you solved a problem without needing instructions

Your internet speed and weekly availability (please convert to US/MST time zone). 

Additionally, briefly explain:

Any experience with job applications, research, or organization tasks

Applications WITHOUT a Loom video will NOT be reviewed.

?

?

, Trello, Slack).

, Trello, and Slack (or willingness to learn quickly)

?

?



Benefits

 • Collaborative, creative environment

 • Flexible work-from-home arrangement (overnight shift)



?



How to Apply

title: Product Support Specialist for a Shopify App (Open to Fresh Graduates)
description:
***NEW GRADUATES WITH A DEGREE IN IT OR COMPUTER SCIENCE ARE WELCOME TO APPLY - TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED***



***PLEASE DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS POSITION IF YOU DO NOT HAVE TECHNICAL PROFICIENCY IN CSS, HTML, OR JAVASCRIPT (AND OTHER PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES)***



We are a leading optimization and personalization platform for Shopify brands. With an AI-powered, never-before-seen visual editor, we enables you to customize every page and component on your store, tailor personalized experiences to multiple audiences, and add product recommendations and upsells through continuous and robust A/B testing.



We are a lean team and a young company, but already working with thousands of leading Shopify brands and agencies, including Laura Geller, Andie Swim, Faherty, Moroccan Oil, and The Oodie.



About the Position: 

We are looking for a Product Support Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering prompt, high-quality responses to customer inquiries. You will take the time to understand each customer's unique needs, including their business size, background, prior interactions, and goals, in order to offer more personalized and insightful support.



The ideal candidate should be personable, detail-oriented, and professional. We expect the ability to achieve excellent service outcomes and demonstrate strong research skills.



The Specialist should be adaptable, able to respond to various requests appropriately (rather than relying on scripts), and strive to deliver exceptional service at all times.



Responsibilities: 

• Monitor, troubleshoot, and respond to inbound and support-related inquiries in real time, providing clear and helpful responses

• Open and monitor Jira tickets, escalating internally as needed

• Go beyond just answering the question at hand—take the time to understand who the customer is, their business size, and their goals to offer relevant and strategic support

• Provide guidance on CRO best practices based on the customer’s needs, with support from the CRO experts



Requirements: 

• Excellent English communication skills: verbal, written, and reading are a MUST 

• Experience in customer support (preferably in SaaS, eCommerce, or tech) is an ADVANTAGE 

• Hands-on Shopify experience is an ADVANTAGE 

• Experience working with HubSpot or similar CRM/ticketing systems is an ADVANTAGE 

• Familiarity with conversion rate optimization (CRO) best practices

• Team player - joining a small team in a fast-paced start-up, hungry to learn and work together

• Proactive, customer-first mindset, with a curiosity to understand the customer’s business and provide context-aware support

• Ability to problem-solve and provide thoughtful and accurate responses



Work Schedule:

• This is a full-time, work-from-home position. You will be working 8 hours a day, 5 days a week, with the option to work 6 days a week.

  

TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION, FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW:



1. Include the phrase "PRODUCT SUPPORT" in your Subject

2. Send a Cover Letter with a link to your CV/Resume



***APPLICATIONS WITHOUT CVS/RESUMES WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***

title: Youtube Video Editor
description:
Video Editor – Basketball YouTube Channel (Remote, Growth Role)



I'm building something special, a basketball YouTube channel with a real vision, great content, and the ambition to grow into something fans love coming back to. I'm looking for the right person to help me get there. If you live and breathe YouTube, love basketball, and want to be part of a channel with real growth.



**Who I'm Looking For**



I need a talented and experienced video editor with deep knowledge in YouTube. You understand why certain thumbnails get clicked, why some hooks make people stay and others make them leave in the first 10 seconds, and what separates a 10K view video from a 1M view video. You've watched and studied enough YouTube to know what works, and you've edited enough to know how to execute it.



A passion for basketball is a big plus. You should know the NBA, know where to find quality footage and highlights, and have a feel for what basketball fans want to watch.



**What You'll Be Doing**



- Editing 6–8 videos per month (with full creative input encouraged)

- Sourcing NBA clips, highlights, and relevant footage

- Crafting compelling intros/hooks that hold viewer attention

- Applying YouTube best practices — pacing, music, graphics, captions — to maximize watch time and retention

- Collaborating closely with the channel owner (that's me — I'm very easy to work with and open to your ideas)



**Offer**



- **Salary: $600–$800/month** depending on experience

- **Performance bonuses** when videos hit view milestones — your hard work pays off directly

- **Real growth potential** — if you're a great fit, I want to promote you to a full Channel Manager role where you'd oversee strategy, content planning, and operations. This is a genuine career opportunity, not just a freelance gig.

- A collaborative working relationship where your creativity is valued



**You're a Great Fit If You...**



- Have a portfolio of YouTube videos you've edited (please share links!)

- Can speak to *why* your edits work — retention strategy, pacing, hooks

- Are a self-starter who doesn't need hand-holding to deliver great work

- Are motivated by results and excited by the idea of bonus pay tied to performance

- Have knowledge of the NBA and know how to source content responsibly

- Communicate clearly and meet deadlines reliably



**How to Apply**



Send me the following:

1. A brief intro about yourself and your YouTube editing experience

2. Links to 2–3 videos you've edited (YouTube preferred)

3. Tell us: *What's one thing most YouTube channels get wrong in the first 30 seconds of a video?*



That last question. Tell me how you think about Youtube. There's no single right answer, we just want to see your YouTube brain in action.



I genuinely believe we can build something great together with the right person. If that sounds like you, I'd love to hear from you.

title: HIRING ASAP! Google Media Buyer (eCommerce)
description:
Help scale brands. Own performance. Drive real revenue.



GTE is a fast-growing global eCommerce company where great ideas don’t sit in slides — they turn into real, measurable growth. We build and scale online brands across international markets, and our tea
mbers take real ownership, grow fast, and help shape the future of the company.



We’re now looking for a performance-driven Google Ads Media Buyer to help take our main revenue channel to the next level.



Why This Role Matters



Google Ads drives around 90% of our total company revenue. That means your work won’t just “support marketing”, it will directly influence the growth of the entire business.



This role is perfect for someone who loves improving systems, scaling performance, and turning data into smarter decisions. You won’t just manage campaigns, you’ll help evolve the way we run Google Ads.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

From day one, you’ll have real ownership. Within your first 90 days, success in this role will mean:

- Developing and rolling out a new or significantly improved Google Ads strategy

- Restructuring and optimizing Google Shopping campaigns for stronger scalability and efficiency

- Driving measurable performance improvements, targeting a 20%+ increase in revenue from Google Ads

- Using performance data to continuously refine bidding strategies, campaign structure, and product feed performance

- Your goal is simple: turn ad spend into scalable, profitable growth.



We’re excited to work with someone who:

- Has at least 3 years of hands-on experience in performance marketing or media buying

- Has direct experience running Google Shopping campaigns for large eCommerce catalogs (10,000+ products)

- Has managed high-budget ad accounts ($300K+ per month)

- Is highly proficient in Google Ads, Google Merchant Center, and Google Analytics

- Ideally has experience with Google CSS Labelizer

- Thinks analytically and uses data to drive decisions, not guesswork

- Enjoys testing, optimizing, and uncovering performance opportunities others might miss

- Is comfortable taking full ownership of results and being accountable for revenue impact



Hiring Process

As part of our process, shortlisted candidates will complete a 19-minute Google Ads knowledge assessment. This helps us understand your hands-on expertise before moving forward to the HR interview stage.

What We’re Looking For

Tempesta Media is seeking an experienced and highly skilled Content Marketing Specialist to join our fast-growing, venture-capital-backed team. This role supports the execution of our content marketing and AI/SEO programs for our clients. The ideal candidate is a self-driven and proactive problem-solver and proficient writer who thrives in a fast-paced environment.

s and other building trades content, using our industry leading technology platform.

• Data Analysis & Reporting: Utilize strong proficiency in MS Excel, AHREFS, Google Search Console and Google GA4 to analyze customer performance and report on KPIs monthly.

Candidate Profile: What We're Looking For
